member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the EXIF data contains the thumbnail.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.ExifData.GetThumbnail
member.summary: Gets the thumbnail stored in Exif data.
member.returns: object if EXIF data contains the thumbnails and thumbnail is valid; otherwise null.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.ExifData.SetThumbnail(Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage)
member.summary: Sets the thumbnail stored in Exif data.
member.param: The thumbnail image. Pass null to remove existing thumbnail.
member.remarks:
This method will store thumbnail as JPEG image with quality 80.
Maximum size of JPEG segment in JPEG file is 64Kb. This limits size of thumbnail stored in JPEG file - thumbnail size can be equal or less than 320x240.
member.exception: Thrown if image size is bigger than 320x240 and 240x320.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.ExifData.SetThumbnail(Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the thumbnail stored in Exif data.
member.param: The thumbnail image. Pass null to remove existing thumbnail.
The JPEG compression quality. Recommended value is 80.
member.remarks: Maximum size of JPEG segment in JPEG file is 64Kb. This limits size of thumbnail stored in JPEG file - thumbnail size can be equal or less than 320x240.
member.exception: Thrown if image size is bigger than 320x240 and 240x320.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.ExifData.CanSaveInJpegFile
member.summary: Determines whether EXIF data can be saved in JPEG file.
member.returns:
True - EXIF data can be saved in JPEG file because EXIF data length is less than 64Kb and can be stored in JPEG segment;
false - EXIF data CANNOT be saved in JPEG file because EXIF data length is greater than 64Kb and CANNOT be stored in JPEG segment.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.JpegFile.Save(System.String,Vintasoft.Imaging.Utils.IProgressController)
member.summary: Saves this JPEG file to specified file.
member.param: The filename to save the image file.
member.exception: Thrown if filename is null.
Thrown if filename is an empty string (""), contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters.
Thrown if the caller does not have the required permission.
Thrown if the specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
Thrown if the access requested is not permitted by the operating system for the specified path, such as when the file or directory is set for read-only access.

Thrown if the specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
member.remarks: This method saves changes to specified file. Current source of the image file is not changed.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.JpegFile.SaveChanges(Vintasoft.Imaging.Utils.IProgressController)
member.summary: Saves changes of this JPEG file to the current source of the image file.
member.exception: Thrown if the source of the JPEG file is undefined.
Thrown if file is open in read-only mode and cannot be changed.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.JpegFile.SaveChanges(System.String,Vintasoft.Imaging.Utils.IProgressController)
member.summary: Saves changes of this JPEG file to specified file.
member.param: The filename to save the image file.
member.exception: Thrown if filename is null.
Thrown if filename is an empty string (""), contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters.
Thrown if the caller does not have the required permission.
Thrown if the specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
Thrown if the access requested is not permitted by the operating system for the specified path, such as when the file or directory is set for read-only access.

Thrown if the specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
member.remarks: This method saves changes to specified file and makes this file as current source of the image file. Previous source of the image file is closed without save changes.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.JpegFile.SaveChanges(System.IO.Stream,Vintasoft.Imaging.Utils.IProgressController)
member.summary: Saves changes of this JPEG file to specified stream.
member.param: Stream to save the image file.
member.exception: Thrown if stream is null.
member.remarks: This method saves changes to specified stream and makes this stream as current source of the image file. Previous source of the image file is closed without save changes.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.JpegFile.SaveWithLosslessRotation(Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.ImageRotateFlipType,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Rotates JPEG image without quality loss and saves rotated JPEG image into specified stream. Method can rotate an image if image width and height are multiples of 16.
member.param: The direction of rotation or flip. Supported values: RotateNoneFlipNone, Rotate90FlipNone, Rotate180FlipNone, Rotate270FlipNone, RotateNoneFlipX, RotateNoneFlipY and equivalents.
Stream to save the image file.
member.exception: Thrown if stream is null.
Thrown if image width or height are not multiples of 16 OR rotateFlip specifies unsupported direction of rotation/flip OR system JPEG encoder is not found.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.JpegPage.GetImageRect(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.EventHandler{Vintasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Returns an image of scaled rectangle of this page.
member.param: The zero based index of first row to decode. Value of this parameter must be multiple in sequential mode, and 0 in progressive mode.
Count of rows to decode. Value of this parameter must be multiple in sequential mode, and equal to in progressive mode.
Scale factor. Value of this parameter must be either 1 or multiple 8 in sequential mode, and either 1 or 8 in progressive mode.
Delegate of the image loading progress. Can be set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.returns: Image of scaled rectangle of this page.
member.exception: Thrown if == .SequentialBaseline and firstRowIndex is less than zero or greater than image height -or- firstRowIndex is not a multiple -or- rowCount is less than zero or greater than available rows count -or- rowCount is not a multiple -or- scale is less than zero or greater than rowCount -or- scale is neither 1 nor a multiple 8. Also thrown if == .Progressive and firstRowIndex is not equal to 0 -or- rowCount is not equal to image height -or- scale is neither 1 nor 8.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Jpeg.JpegPage.GetImageRect(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.DecodingSettings,System.EventHandler{Vintasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventArgs},System.EventHandler{Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageRendering.IntermediateImageRequestEventArgs})
member.summary: Returns an image of scaled rectangle of this page.
member.param: Decoding settings used for decode the image of page.

Count of rows to decode. Value of this parameter must be multiple in sequential mode, and equal to in progressive mode.
Scale factor. Value of this parameter must be either 1 or multiple 8 in sequential mode, and either 1 or 8 in progressive mode.
Delegate of the image loading progress. Can be set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Delegate for requesting intermediate image. Can be set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic)
member.returns: Image of scaled rectangle of this page.
member.exception: Thrown if == .SequentialBaseline and firstRowIndex is less than zero or greater than image height -or- firstRowIndex is not a multiple -or- rowCount is less than zero or greater than available rows count -or- rowCount is not a multiple -or- scale is less than zero or greater than rowCount -or- scale is neither 1 nor a multiple 8. Also thrown if == .Progressive and firstRowIndex is not equal to 0 -or- rowCount is not equal to image height -or- scale is neither 1 nor 8.

member.summary: Specifies available photometric interpretations for TIFF image.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.PhotometricInterpretation.WhiteIsZero
member.summary: For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as white.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.PhotometricInterpretation.BlackIsZero
member.summary: For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as black.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.PhotometricInterpretation.Rgb
member.summary: RGB. RGB value of (0,0,0) represents black, and (255,255,255) represents white, assuming 8-bit components. The components are stored in the indicated order: first Red, then Green, then Blue.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.PhotometricInterpretation.Palette
member.summary: Palette color. In this model, a color is described with a single component. The value of the component is used as an index into the red, green and blue curves in the ColorMap field to retrieve an RGB triplet that defines the color. When PhotometricInterpretation=3 is used, ColorMap must be present and SamplesPerPixel must be 1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.PhotometricInterpretation.TransparencyMask
member.summary: Transparency Mask. This means that the image is used to define an irregularly shaped region of another image in the same TIFF file. SamplesPerPixel and BitsPerSample must be 1. PackBits compression is recommended. The 1-bits define the interior of the region; the 0-bits define the exterior of the region.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.PhotometricInterpretation.Cmyk
member.summary: CMYK.

member.summary: YCbCr.

member.summary: CIE L*a*b*.

member.summary: CIE L*a*b*, alternate encoding also known as ICC L*a*b*.

member.summary: CIE L*a*b*, alternate encoding also known as ITU L*a*b*, defined in ITU-T Rec. T.42, used in the TIFF-F and TIFF-FX standard (RFC 2301).

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffTagDataType
member.summary: Specifies available tag data types.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffTagDataType.Byte
member.summary: 8-bit unsigned integer.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffTagDataType.Ascii
member.summary: 8-bit byte that contains a 7-bit ASCII code; the last byte must be NUL (binary zero).

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffTagDataType.Short
member.summary: 16-bit (2-byte) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffTagDataType.Long
member.summary: 32-bit (4-byte) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffTagDataType.Rational
member.summary: Two LONGs: the first represents the numerator of a fraction; the second, the denominator.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffTagDataType.SByte
member.summary: An 8-bit signed (twos-complement) integer.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffTagDataType.Undefined
member.summary: An 8-bit byte that may contain anything, depending on the definition of the field.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffTagDataType.SShort

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage
member.summary: Represents a page of TIFF file.
member.remarks:
Class allows to:
get TIFF Image File Directory of page
get information about page image (width, height, bits per pixel, palette, resolution, compression)
get page image
get strip of page image
get tile of page image
save page image to a file or stream

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This constructor creates the empty page (page without image).

member.summary: Gets the TIFF Image File Directory associates with this TIFF page.

member.summary: Gets the width, in pixels, of this TIFF page.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.Height
member.summary: Gets the height, in pixels, of this TIFF page.

member.summary: Gets the number of bits per pixel for image returned by method.
member.remarks: Values of the and properties may be different if image data will be converted to another format during image decoding.

member.summary: Gets the number of bits per pixel for image data stored in TIFF image.
member.remarks: Values of the and properties may be different if image data will be converted to another format during image decoding.

member.summary: Gets the resolution, in pixels per inch, of this TIFF page.
member.value: The resolution loaded from an image metadata if returns true; otherwise, the default (screen) resolution.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.HasResolution
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the information about image resolution is stored in a TIFF page.
member.value:
True - the property returns resolution loaded from image file;
false - the property returns the default (screen) resolution.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.Palette
member.summary: Gets a palette of this TIFF page.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.Compression
member.summary: Gets the compression algorithm, which is used for compressing this TIFF page image.

member.summary: Returns an image grid based on strips if the image data stored as strips.
member.returns: Image grid based on strips if the image data stored as strips; otherwise, null.

member.summary: Returns an image grid based on tiles if the image data stored as tiles.
member.returns: Image grid based on tiles if the image data stored as tiles; otherwise, null.

member.summary: Returns an image grid based on "virtual" tiles with size 512x512 if image data is not compressed.
member.returns: Image grid based on "virtual" tiles with size 512x512 if image data is not compressed; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.GetImageRectScales
member.summary: Returns an array of scale factors for rectangles of image grid.
member.returns: An array of scale factors for rectangles of image grid.
member.remarks:
Possible values of scale factor:
1 - page can return image rectangle without scaling
N - page can return an image rectangle reduced N times

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.CanReadImageRegion(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines that decoder can read a region of image.
member.returns: true if decoder can read a region of the image; false if decoder can read only rectangle of the image.
member.remarks: Region represents a rectangular region on the image and composed from a sequence of rectangles.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.GetImage(Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.DecodingSettings,System.EventHandler{Vintasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Returns an image of this TIFF page.
member.param: Decoding settings used for decode the image of page.
member.returns: The image associated with this TiffPage object if image was loaded successfully; null if image loading was canceled.
member.exception: Thrown if error occurred while loading of image.
member.remarks: This method creates background threads for loading the image, count of thread can be set with the .MaxThreads property.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.GetEmbeddedThumbnail
member.summary: Gets the embedded thumbnail of the TIFF page.
member.returns: The embedded thumbnail if TIFF page has embedded thumbnail; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.GetStripImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.DecodingSettings,System.EventHandler{Vintasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Returns an image of the TIFF page strips.
member.param: The zero based index of the first strip.
The zero based index of the last strip.
Progress delegate of strips image loading.
Decoding settings used for decode the image of page.
member.returns: Image of the TIFF page strips if image was loaded successfully; otherwise, null.
member.exception: Thrown if firstStripIndex is less than zero or greater than number of strips -or- lastStripIndex is less than zero or greater than number of strips -or- scale has unsupported value.
Thrown if this page does not have strips.
Thrown if image data are divided on color planes. In this case values of the firstStripIndex and lastStripIndex parameters must be the same - image only one strip can be get.
Thrown if error occurred during loading of image.
member.remarks: This method is synchronous.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.SetStripImage(System.Int32,Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage,System.EventHandler{Vintasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Sets an image of the TIFF page strip.
member.param: Progress delegate of strip image encoding.
member.exception: Thrown if TIFF page does not have strips -or- page bit depth is not equal image strip bit depth -or- strip size is not equal image strip size.
Thrown if stripIndex is less than zero or greater than number of strips.
member.remarks: This method is synchronous.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.GetTileImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.DecodingSettings,System.EventHandler{Vintasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Returns an image of the TIFF page tile.
member.param: Decoding settings used for decode the image of page.
Progress delegate of tile image loading.
member.returns: Image of tile of this TiffPage object if image was loaded successfully; otherwise, null.
member.exception: Thrown if tileIndex is less than zero or greater than number of tiles.
Thrown if this page does not have tiles.
Thrown if error occurred while loading of image.
member.remarks: This method is synchronous.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.SetTileImage(System.Int32,Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage,System.EventHandler{Vintasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Sets an image of the TIFF page tile.
member.param: Progress delegate of tile image encoding.
member.exception: Thrown if tileImage is null.
Thrown if tileIndex is less than zero or greater than number of tiles.
Thrown if page does not have tiles -or- page bit depth is not equal image tile bit depth -or- tile size is not equal image tile size.
member.remarks: This method is synchronous.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.GetImageRect(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.DecodingSettings,System.EventHandler{Vintasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Returns the rectangle image of this TIFF page if image data are non compressed ( == .None).
member.param: The zero based index of left-top rectangle.
The zero based index of right-bottom rectangle.
Decoding settings used for decode the image of page.
member.returns: Image of rectangle of this TiffPage object if image was loaded successfully; otherwise, null.
member.exception: Thrown if if is not equal to .
Thrown if leftTopRectangleIndex is less than zero or greater than number of rectangles in image grid OR rightBottomRectangleIndex is less than zero or greater than number of rectangles in image grid.
Thrown if error occurred while loading of image.
member.remarks:
This method is optimized for reading uncompressed data and can be used only when the method returned not null value.
This method is working in current thread.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves an image associated with this TIFF page to the specified path.
member.param: A string that contains the name of the file to which to save image.
member.exception: Thrown if filename is null.
member.remarks:
Supported image formats: BMP, GIF, JPEG, PDF, PNG, TIFF, multipage TIFF.
Suitable encoder will be selected automatically by using the extension of the filename.
object will be used for saving image if the suitable encoder will not be found by using the extension of the filename.
The image cannot be saved to the file from which it was loaded.
This method always will create a new TIFF file.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffPage.Save(System.String,Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.EncoderBase)
member.summary: Saves an image associated with this TIFF page to the specified path by the specified encoder.
member.param: Encoder which should be used for saving image.
A string that contains the name of the file to which to save image.
member.exception: Thrown if filename or encoder is null.
member.remarks:
Supported image formats: BMP, GIF, JPEG, PDF, PNG, TIFF, multipage TIFF.
The image cannot be saved to the file from which it was loaded.
This method will add image to the multipage TIFF file if appropriate parameter is set in the object.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffFile
member.summary: Provides low-level functions for manipulating TIFF file.
member.remarks:
Class allows to:
get TIFF file info
get collection of TIFF pages
get TIFF page info (see the for more info)
add TIFF page
insert TIFF page
delete TIFF page
save TIFF page in a separate image file
pack TIFF file (remove unused space)
Supported compression algorithms:
without compression (read / write)
CCITT Group 3 fax (read)
CCITT Group 4 fax (read / write)
CCITT Rle (read)
Macintosh Packbits (read)
LZW (read / write)
Deflate (read / write)
JPEG (read / write)

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Tiff.TiffFileFormat.BigEndian
member.summary: Byte order is from the most significant byte to the least significant byte. This format is used by Motorola platform, i.e. on Mac computers.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Ico.IconPageCollection.Add(Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage,Vintasoft.Imaging.Utils.IProgressController)
member.summary: Adds image as page to the page collection.
member.param: The image to add to the collection.
member.exception: Thrown if image is null.
Thrown if width or height of image is greater than 256.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Ico.IconPageCollection.Add(Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage,Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage,Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.Ico.IconCompression)
member.summary: Adds image as new Icon page to the page collection, using specified transparency mask and compression.
member.param: The image to add to the collection.
member.remarks:
Source image is image.
Transparency mask (transparencyMask) defines transparency of image and stored as 1-bpp image. Transparency mask must be set to null, in this case transparency mask contains 0.
Result image is source image combined with transparency mask.
Size of source image and transparency mask must be the same.
Pixel of result image is transparent if corresponding pixel in transparency mask is set to 1.
Pixel of result image is not changed if corresponding pixel in transparency mask is set to 0.
Data are stored as source image and transparency mask if BMP compression is used.
Data are stored as result image if PNG compression is used.
member.exception: Thrown if image is null.
Thrown if maskImage is not 1 bpp -or- width or height of image is greater than 256 -or- image and maskImage has different size.

member.param: Images to add to the collection.
member.exception: Thrown if images is null.

member.remarks:

Result image is source image combined with transparency mask.
Size of source image and transparency mask must be the same.
Pixel of result image is transparent if corresponding pixel in transparency mask is set to 1.
Pixel of result image is not changed if corresponding pixel in transparency mask is set to 0.
Data are stored as source image and transparency mask if BMP compression is used.
Data are stored as result image if PNG compression is used.
member.exception: Thrown if index is less than 0 or greater than .
Thrown if image is null.
Thrown if maskImage is not 1 bpp -or- width or height of image is greater than 256 -or- image and maskImage has different size.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImageFileSource.ReadSBytes(System.Int32)

member.returns: A signed byte array containing data read from the stream of the image file. This might be less than the number of bytes requested if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImageFileSource.ReadChars(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)

The starting point in the buffer at which to begin reading into the buffer.
The number of characters to read.
member.returns: The total number of characters read into the buffer. This might be less than the number of characters requested if that many characters are not currently available, or it might be zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImagePage
member.summary: Provides the abstract base class for page of image file.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImagePage.#ctor(Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImageFileSource,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Offset of the image page in the source.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImagePage.Width
member.summary: Gets the width, in pixels, of the image page.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImagePage.Height
member.summary: Gets the height, in pixels, of the image page.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImagePage.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Gets the number of bits per pixel of the image page.
member.value:
For 1-bpp black-white image this value will return 1.
For 2-bpp palette/gray image this value will return 8 because image page will be returned as 8-bpp palette/gray image.
For 4-bpp palette/gray image this value will return 8 because image page will be returned as 8-bpp palette/gray image.
For 8-bpp palette/gray image this value will return 8.
For 24-bpp RGB image this value will return 24.
For 32-bpp ARGB image this value will return 32.
For 48-bpp RGB image this value will return 48.
For 64-bpp ARGB image this value will return 64.
For 32-bpp CMYK image this value will return 24 because image page will be returned as 24-bpp RGB image.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImagePage.SourceBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Gets the number of bits per pixel of image data of the image page.
member.value:
For 1-bpp black-white image this value will return 1.
For 2-bpp palette/gray image this value will return 2.
For 4-bpp palette/gray image this value will return 4.
For 8-bpp palette/gray image this value will return 8.
For 24-bpp RGB image this value will return 24.
For 32-bpp ARGB image this value will return 32.
For 48-bpp RGB image this value will return 48.
For 64-bpp ARGB image this value will return 64.
For 32-bpp CMYK image this value will return 32.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImagePage.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution, in pixels per inch, of the image page.
member.value: The resolution loaded from an image metadata if returns true; otherwise, the default (screen) resolution.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImagePage.HasResolution
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the information about image resolution is stored in an image page.
member.value:
True - the property returns resolution loaded from image file;
false - the property returns the default (screen) resolution.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.ImageFiles.ImagePage.Palette
member.summary: Gets the palette of the image page.

member.returns: The image associated with this ImagePage object if image was loaded successfully; null if image loading was canceled.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.JpegDecoder.GetThumbnail(System.Int32,System.Drawing.Size,Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.DecodingSettings,Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.RenderingSettings,System.EventHandler{Vintasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Returns a thumbnail image of the specified page of the image source.
member.param: The zero based page index. This parameter is not used and can be set to 0.
Decoding settings used for decode the thumbnail of page.
Rendering settings used for rendering the thumbnail of page.
Delegate of the thumbnail loading progress. Can be set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.returns: Thumbnail image of the specified page of the image source.
member.remarks:
Method does the following steps:
Tries to get thumbnail from JFIF-segment.
Tries to get thumbnail from JFXX-segment if thumbnail is not found on the previous step.
Tries to get thumbnail from EXIF-segment if thumbnail is not found on the previous steps.
Generates image thumbnail if thumbnail is not found on the previous steps OR image and thumbnail are not proportional.

member.returns: Metadata of JPEG file.

member.returns: true if decoder can progressively read the image; false if decoder cannot progressively read the image.

member.summary: Determines that decoder can read a region of the image.

member.returns: true if decoder can read a region of the image; false if decoder can read only rectangle of the image.
member.remarks: Region represents a rectangular region on the image and composed from a sequence of rectangles.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.JpegDecoder.GetImageRectGrid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an image grid as array of rectangles.
member.param: The zero based page index. This parameter is not used and can be set to 0.
member.returns: An image grid as array of rectangles.
member.remarks: Method must return an array with one rectangle which size is equal to the size of image if decoder cannot get image by parts.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.JpegDecoder.GetImageRectScales(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an array of scale factors for rectangles of image grid.
member.param: The zero based page index. This parameter is not used and can be set to 0.
member.returns: An array of scale factors for rectangles of image grid.
member.remarks:
Possible values of scale factor:
1 - decoder can return image rectangle without scaling
N - decoder can return an image rectangle reduced N times

member.summary: Contains decoding settings of JPEG file/stream.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.JpegDecodingSettings.ChannelsMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of numbers describing how to map image samples into the range of values appropriate for the image color space.
member.value: Default value is null. Default value is equivalent of [0 1 0 1 0 1 0 1] value for jpeg CMYK.
member.remarks: An image data stream is initially decomposed into integers in the domain 0 to 255. array specifies a linear mapping of each integer component value to a number that would be appropriate as a component value in the image color space.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.JpegDecodingSettings.InvertCmykColorChannels
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether image's CMYK channels should be inverted.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.JpegDecodingSettings.SourceColorFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a source color format for JPEG decoding.
member.value: Default value is null, i.e. the native color format of JPEG file is used.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.JpegDecodingSettings.DestColorFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a destination color format for JPEG decoding.
member.value: Default value is null, i.e. the BGR format is used for color JPEG files and the Grayscale format is used for gray JPEG files.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Decoders.JpegDecodingSettings.SubsamplingInterpolationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the interpolation mode for subsampled channels of JPEG image.
member.value:
.None must be used for pictures.
.NearestNeighbor must be used for images with text. This interpolation mode increases quality of image with text but also increases decoding time.
Default value is JpegSubsamplingInterpolationMode.None.

member.remarks: Value of this property has no effect if are specified explicitly.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.JpegEncoderSettings.SaveAsGrayscale
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether color images will be saved as grayscale JPEG files.
member.value: true color images will be saved as grayscale JPEG files; false color images will be saved as color JPEG files.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.JpegEncoderSettings.GenerateOptimalHuffmanTables
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether JPEG file with the optimal Huffman tables must be created.
member.value:
false - JPEG file with standard (static) Huffman tables will be created, encoding will be faster, but JPEG file size will not be optimal; true - JPEG file with optimal (dynamic) Huffman tables will be created, encoding will be some slower, but JPEG file size will be optimal.
Default value is false.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.JpegEncoderSettings.AnnotationsFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a format in which annotations must be saved.
member.value: Supported values: AnnotationsFormat.VintasoftBinary, AnnotationsFormat.VintasoftXmp.
member.exception: Thrown if annotations format is not supported.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.JpegEncoderSettings.QuantizationTables
member.summary: Gets or sets quantization tables for the JPEG image.
member.value:
The array must contain from 1 to 4 arrays, each of them containing 64 elements of a quantization table in a zig-zag order for a component with index equal to the index of the array. Number of quantization tables must be sufficient for components of JPEG image. Each element of a quantization table must be in range from 1 to 255.
Default value is null.
member.remarks:
If value of this property is null then quantization tables will be generated depending on the value of the . Otherwise, value of the is ignored, and specified tables are used.
When encoding CMYK images, quantization tables should be specified explicitly.
member.exception: Thrown if quantization table count is less than 1 or greater than 4.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.JpegEncoderSettings.SamplingFactors
member.summary: Gets or sets sampling factors for the JPEG image.
member.value:
The array must contain from 2 to 8 elements, each consecutive pair representing horizontal and vertical sampling factors for a component with corresponding index. Number of sampling factors must be sufficient for components of JPEG image. Each sampling factor must be in range from 1 to 4.
Default value is null.
member.remarks: If value of this property is null then sampling factors will be generated depending on the value of the property. Otherwise, value of the is ignored, and specified factors are used.
member.exception: Thrown if sampling factor count is less than 2 or greater than 8.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.JpegEncoderSettings.InvertCmykColorChannels
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether image's CMYK channels should be inverted.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.JpegEncoderSettings.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the instance.
member.returns: A new object that is a copy of the instance.

member.exception: Thrown if tile width is 0 and tile height is not 0 OR tile height is 0 and tile width is not 0 OR tile width is not multiple 16 OR tile height is not multiple 16.

0 - no compression, 9 - the best and slowest compression level.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether image must be copied with common metadata.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether image must be copied with EXIF metadata.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.TiffEncoderSettings.CopyGpsMetadata
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether image must be copied with GPS metadata.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.TiffEncoderSettings.BinarizationCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the binarization command, which must be used if color image must be converted to a black-white image before saving to a TIFF file.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.Codecs.Encoders.TiffEncoderSettings.SupportLegacyTiffViewers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the encoder must create TIFF files, which are compatible with legacy TIFF viewers.
member.remarks:
Old TIFF specification allows to store the StripByteCounts tag data only as Long values. Current TIFF specification allows to store the StripByteCounts tag data as Short and Long values.
By default TIFF encoder optimizes the StripByteCounts tag data and tries to store tag data as Short values because this allows to create smaller TIFF file.
Also TIFF encoder optimizes the data of some other TIFF tags.
This property allows to disable the optimization and guarantee that created TIFF file will be compatible with legacy TIFF viewers.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether annotations appearance must be saved in PDF document.
member.value:
true - SDK will save to PDF document:
annotation in Vintasoft format, annotation will be visible in Vintasoft.Imaging.Annotation.AnnotationViewer and Vintasoft.Imaging.Annotation.AnnotatedThumbnailViewer"
PDF appearance of annotation, annotation will be visible in Adobe Reader and all PDF compatible viewers.
false - SDK will save to PDF document:
annotation in Vintasoft format, annotation will be visible in Vintasoft.Imaging.Annotation.AnnotationViewer and Vintasoft.Imaging.Annotation.AnnotatedThumbnailViewer
Default value: true.
member.remarks:
You can set value of this property to false if you plan to view your PDF documents only with your software.
PDF document will have smaller size than value of this property is set to false.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorTransformsOptimizer
member.summary: Contains static methods for creating optimized versions of color transforms.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorTransformsOptimizer.GetOptimizedTransform(Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorTransform)
member.summary: Returns an optimized thread-unsafe color transform that is identical to the specified color transform.
member.returns: A that is identical to the original color transform, or null if transform is identity transform.
member.exception: Thrown if transform is null.
Thrown if threadSafeColorTransform is true and transform is not thread-safe.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorTransformsOptimizer.GetOptimizedTransform(Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorTransform,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an optimized color transform that is identical to the specified color transform with specified thread-safety.
member.param: Indicates whether result color transform should be thread-safe.
member.returns: A that is identical to the original color transform, or null if transform is identity transform.
member.exception: Thrown if transform is null.
Thrown if threadSafeColorTransform is true and transform is not thread-safe.
member.remarks:
Method will return thread-safe transform if value of the threadSafeColorTransform parameter is set to true. Method will return not thread-safe transform if value of the threadSafeColorTransform parameter is set to false.
In most cases the not thread-safe transform is faster than thread-safe transform and not thread-safe transform should be used if thread safety is not necessary.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorTransforms
member.summary: Represents a collection of most commonly used standard color transforms.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorTransforms.RgbToGrayAverage
member.summary: Gets a standard color transform from RGB to Gray using Average method.
member.remarks: This color transform uses the following formula: Gray = (R + G + B) / 3.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorTransforms.RgbToGrayLightness
member.summary: Gets a standard color transform from RGB to Gray using Lightness method.
member.remarks: This color transform uses the following formula: Gray = 0.5 * (max(R,G,B) + min(R,G,B))

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorTransforms.RgbToGrayLuminosity
member.summary: Gets a standard color transform from RGB to Gray using Luminosity method.
member.remarks: This color transform uses the following formula: Gray = 0.21 * R + 0.72 * G + 0.07 * B

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorTransforms.GrayToRgb
member.summary: Gets a standard color transform from Gray to RGB.
member.remarks:
This color transform uses the following formula:
R = Gray
G = Gray
B = Gray

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorSpaceFormat
member.summary: Specifies a color space and order of color channels.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorSpaceFormat.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorSpaceFormat.#ctor(Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorChannelsOrder)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorSpaceFormat.#ctor(Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorSpaceType,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A sequence of channel ordinal numbers.
member.remarks:
The channelsOrder array defines a remapping of default channels sequence.
For example, if color space is RGB and channels order is [2,0,1] then defined color format is BRG.
Values of the channelsOrder can contain undefined channels.
For example, BGRA color format can be specified using RGB color space and [2,1,0,3] values of channels order.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorSpaceFormat.#ctor(Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorSpaceType,Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorChannelsOrder)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks:
The channelsOrder defines a remapping of default channels sequence.
For example, if color space is RGB and channels order is [2,0,1] then defined color format is BRG.
Values of the channelsOrder can contain undefined channels.
For example, BGRA color format can be specified using RGB color space and [2,1,0,3] values of channels order.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorSpaceFormat.ColorSpace
member.summary: Gets the color space of this .

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorSpaceFormat.ColorChannelsOrder
member.summary: Gets the color channels order of this .
member.remarks:
Value of this property defines a remapping of default channels sequence.
For example, if color space is RGB and channels order is [2,0,1] then defined color format is BRG.
Values of the channelsOrder can contain undefined channels.
For example, BGRA color format can be specified using RGB color space and [2,1,0,3] values of channels order.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.ColorSpaceFormat.ColorChannelCount
member.summary: Gets the channels count of this .
member.remarks:
Value of this property determines the number of channels within this .
For example, if channels order is [2,0,1] then color channels count is 3.

member.summary: One clipping region is replaced by another.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Drawing.RegionCombineMode.Intersect
member.summary: Two clipping regions are combined by taking their intersection.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Drawing.RegionCombineMode.Union
member.summary: Two clipping regions are combined by taking the union of both.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Drawing.RegionCombineMode.Xor
member.summary: Two clipping regions are combined by taking only the areas enclosed by one or the other region, but not both.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Drawing.RegionCombineMode.Exclude
member.summary: Specifies that the existing region is replaced by the result of the new region being removed from the existing region. Said differently, the new region is excluded from the existing region.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.Drawing.RegionCombineMode.Complement
member.summary: Specifies that the existing region is replaced by the result of the existing region being removed from the new region. Said differently, the existing region is excluded from the new region.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangeChannelsFormatCommand
member.summary: Changes channels format of image.
member.remarks: This command supports images with .Undefined pixel format (N-channels and M-bits per channel).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangeChannelsFormatCommand.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the command.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangeChannelsFormatCommand.SupportedNativePixelFormats
member.summary: Gets the read-only list of supported pixel formats for this processing command.
member.value: Supported pixel formats: PixelFormat.BlackWhite, PixelFormat.Indexed1, PixelFormat.Indexed4, PixelFormat.Indexed8, PixelFormat.Gray8, PixelFormat.Gray16, PixelFormat.Bgr555, PixelFormat.Bgr565, PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Bgr48, PixelFormat.Bgr32, PixelFormat.Bgra32, PixelFormat.Bgra64.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangeChannelsFormatCommand.ChannelsFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the target channels format.
member.value: Default value is null.
member.remarks: Setting this property value will set the to .Undefined.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangeChannelsFormatCommand.PixelFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the target pixel format.
member.value: The pixel format.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangeChannelsFormatCommand.RestoreSourcePixelFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the processing command must restore the source pixel format of processed image.
member.exception: Thrown if value is true.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangeChannelsFormatCommand.GetOutputPixelFormat(Vintasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat)
member.summary: Returns the pixel format of output image (image after processing) for input image with specified pixel format.
member.returns: Pixel format of output image.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangeChannelsFormatCommand.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new processing command that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new processing command that is a copy of this instance.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangeChannelsFormatCommand.CopyTo(Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ProcessingCommandBase)
member.summary: Copies the state of the current command to the target command.
member.param: Command to copy the state of the current command to.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangeChannelsFormatCommand.ProcessImageInPlace(Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage)
member.summary: Processes the image in-place.
member.returns: true if image is processed; false if processing is canceled or not necessary.
member.exception: Thrown if channels format is not specified -or- target format and processing image have different number of significant channels.
member.remarks: This method changes the image.

member.summary: Gets or sets an array of images which represent channels of destination image.

If array contains only 1 image, only channel specified by will be set.
If array contains more than 1 image, all significant channels will be set; in that case the number of elements must be equal to the number of significant channels of processing image, value of the is set to -1 and cannot be changed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the channel if single channel image is specified.
member.value: Valid values are all non negative integers.
member.exception: Thrown if new channel index is negative.
Thrown if has length greater than 1.
member.remarks: In order to set all significant channels, use .

member.summary: Increases sharpness of an image using the highpass filtering in frequency domain.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the name of the command.

member.summary: Gets the read-only list of supported pixel formats for this processing command.
member.value: Supported pixel formats: PixelFormat.Gray8, PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Bgr32, PixelFormat.Bgra32.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.Filters.ImageSharpeningCommand.BlendingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the blending mode.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.Filters.ImageSharpeningCommand.OverlayAlpha
member.summary: Gets or sets the alpha (transparency) value that must be used when the image, which is received after the highpass filtering of source image, must be overlayed on the source image.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0 or more than 1.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.Filters.ImageSharpeningCommand.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of frequency filter.
member.value: Default value is Gaussian.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.Filters.ImageSharpeningCommand.Radius
member.summary: Gets or sets the filter radius in pixels.
member.value: Default value is 12.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less or equal to zero.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.Filters.ImageSharpeningCommand.GrayscaleFiltration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the command must convert the source image to the grayscale image before the image spectrum filtering.
member.value:
True - the command must convert the source image to the grayscale image before the image spectrum filtering. Command performs filtering on a single channel.
false - the command must not change the source image before the image spectrum filtering. Command performs filtering on all channels of the source image.
Default value is true.

member.summary: Returns the pixel format of output image (image after processing) for input image with specified pixel format.
member.returns: Pixel format of output image.

member.returns: A new processing command that is a copy of this instance.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizationType
member.summary: Specifies available methods for visualizing spectrum of Fourier Transform.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizationType.Real
member.summary: Visualizes the real part of the image spectrum.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizationType.Imaginary
member.summary: Visualizes the imaginary part of the image spectrum.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizationType.Magnitude
member.summary: Visualizes the magnitude of the image spectrum.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizationType.SquareRootMagnitude
member.summary: Visualizes the square root of the magnitude of the image spectrum.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizationType.LogarithmMagnitude
member.summary: Visualizes the natural logarithm of the magnitude of the image spectrum.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizerCommand
member.summary: Visualizes an image spectrum, which is obtained by the Fast Fourier Transform.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizerCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizerCommand.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the command.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizerCommand.SpectrumProcessing
member.summary: Gets or sets a command, which is used for spectrum processing.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizerCommand.GrayscaleVisualization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether grayscale spectrum should be visualized.
member.value:
True - the command must convert the source image to the grayscale image before the image spectrum visualizing;
false - spectrums of each image channel are visualized at the corresponding channels of resulting image. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizerCommand.UseNormalization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether normalization should be used.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizerCommand.UseAbsoluteValues
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether absolute values should be used.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizerCommand.VisualizationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the spectrum visualization.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizerCommand.SpectrumImageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the visualized spectrum.
member.value:
0 - size of the output image is determined automatically, i.e. the output image size will be calculated as the closest power of 2 to the largest input image side; otherwise, the property value will be used as the output image size.
Value should be a power of 2.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0 or not a power of 2.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FrequencySpectrumVisualizerCommand.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new processing command that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new processing command that is a copy of this instance.

member.param: Command to copy the state of the current command to.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetImageColorDepthCommand.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the command.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetImageColorDepthCommand.SupportedNativePixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of supported native pixel formats for this processing command.
member.value: Supported pixel formats: PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Gray8, PixelFormat.Indexed8.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetImageColorDepthCommand.CanModifyImage
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether this command modifies image.
member.value: Always returns false.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetImageColorDepthCommand.MaxInaccuracy
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum permissible inaccuracy, as distance in RGB888 color space, when comparing two colors.
member.value:
Valid values are from 0 to 442.
0 means that command will search for unique colors in an image.
Value from 1 to 442 means that command will search colors with permissible inaccuracy.
Default value is 0.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to check that an image is a black and white image.
member.value: Default value is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to check that an image is a grayscale image.
member.value: Default value is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to check that an image is a palette image with 2 colors.
member.value: Default value is true.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetImageColorDepthCommand.DetectIndexed4
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to check that an image is a palette image with 16 colors.
member.value: Default value is true.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetImageColorDepthCommand.DetectIndexed8
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to check that an image is a palette image with 256 colors.
member.value: Default value is true.

member.summary: Gets a list of supported native pixel formats for this processing command.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetColorCountCommand.MaxInaccuracy
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum permissible inaccuracy, as distance in RGB color space, when comparing two colors.
member.value:
Valid values are from 0 to 442.
0 means that command will search for unique colors in an image.
Value from 1 to 442 means that command will search colors with permissible inaccuracy.
Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetColorCountCommand.MaxColorCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowable number of colors in an image.
member.value:
0 - number of colors in an image is not limited, command will analyze all image;
any positive value - maximum allowable number of colors in an image, command will stop searching when maximum allowable number of colors in an image will be reached.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetColorCountCommand.ColorCount
member.summary: Gets the number of colors in an image.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the name of the command.

member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether this command modifies image.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetRotationAngleCommand.SupportedNativePixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of supported native pixel formats for this processing command.
member.value: Supported pixel formats: PixelFormat.BlackWhite, PixelFormat.Indexed1, PixelFormat.Indexed4, PixelFormat.Indexed8, PixelFormat.Gray8, PixelFormat.Gray16, PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Bgr32, PixelFormat.Bgra32.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetRotationAngleCommand.ExpandSupportedPixelFormats
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the processing command need to convert the processing image to the nearest pixel format without color loss () if processing command does not support pixel format of the processing image ().
member.value: True - the processing command need to convert the processing image to the nearest pixel format without color loss; otherwise, false. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetRotationAngleCommand.PixelFormatExpandingMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the method, which defines how to expand the supported pixel formats when native pixel formats must be expanded.
member.value: Default value ImageConversionMethod.Lossless|ImageConversionMethod.Lossy.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetRotationAngleCommand.ScanIntervalX
member.summary: Gets or sets scan interval, in pixels, on X axis.
member.value:
Valid values are from 1 to image.Width: 1 - every column will be scanned, 2 - every second column will be scanned, 3 - every third column will be scanned, and so on.
Recommended values are from 1 to 10.
Default value is 1.
member.remarks:
The large value of this property may speed up deskewing process but may worsen results.
This property is used only for detecting the image rotation angle and is not used at image rotation.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetRotationAngleCommand.ScanIntervalY
member.summary: Gets or sets scan interval, in pixels, on Y axis.
member.value:
Valid values are from 1 to image.Height: 1 - every row will be scanned, 2 - every second row will be scanned, 3 - every third row will be scanned, and so on.
Recommended values are from 1 to 10.
Default value is 1.
member.remarks:
The large value of this property may speed up deskewing process but may worsen results.
This property is used only for detecting the image rotation angle and is not used at image rotation.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetRotationAngleCommand.Angle
member.summary: Gets the detected rotation angle, in degrees.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetRotationAngleCommand.Confidence
member.summary: Gets the confidence, in percents, of the result.
member.value: Valid values are from 0 (0%) to 1 (100%).

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetRotationAngleCommand.MaxAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum possible angle (clockwise and counterclockwise), in degrees, detected by command.
member.value:
Valid values are from 0 to 90. Default value is 0.
0 means that command will detect the maximum possible angle automatically and use the following algorithm:
Command will use 45 degrees as the maximum possible angle and will try to determine the rotation angle.
Command will return the result if result is NOT close to 45 degrees or -45 degrees.
Command will use 90 degrees as the maximum possible angle and AGAIN will try to determine the rotation angle if result on previous step is close to 45 degrees or -45 degrees.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than zero or more than 90.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Info.GetRotationAngleCommand.GetOutputPixelFormat(Vintasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat)
member.summary: Returns the pixel format of output image (image after processing) for input image with specified pixel format.
member.returns: Pixel format of output image.

Supported pixel formats depend from :
Bilinear interpolation: PixelFormat.Gray8, PixelFormat.Indexed8, PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Bgr32, PixelFormat.Bgra32, PixelFormat.Gray16, PixelFormat.Bgr48, PixelFormat.Bgra64.
NearestNeighbor interpolation: PixelFormat.Gray8, PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Bgr32, PixelFormat.Bgra32, PixelFormat.Gray16, PixelFormat.Bgr48, PixelFormat.Bgra64.
Other interpolations: PixelFormat.Bgra32

member.summary: Gets or sets the rectangle, in pixels, that defines how to crop image after transformation.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.MatrixTransformCommand.PreservePixelFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the image processing command preserves the pixel format of processing images.
member.value: true - processed image will have same pixel format as the source image; false - processed image will have pixel format Bgr24 or Bgra32.
member.remarks: Setting this property's value to false allows to improve performance because preserving the pixel format is not required. Also, it allows to perform your own conversion of processed image from Bgr24/Bgra32 to required format.

member.summary: Gets a list of supported native pixel formats for this processing command.
member.value:
Supported pixel formats depend from :
Bilinear interpolation: PixelFormat.Gray8, PixelFormat.Indexed8, PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Bgr32, PixelFormat.Bgra32, PixelFormat.Gray16, PixelFormat.Bgr48, PixelFormat.Bgra64.
NearestNeighbor interpolation: PixelFormat.Gray8, PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Bgr32, PixelFormat.Bgra32, PixelFormat.Gray16, PixelFormat.Bgr48, PixelFormat.Bgra64.

member.exception: Thrown if interpolation mode is NOT supported.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.QuadrilateralWarpCommand.DestinationPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of four or three points that define a quadrangle.
member.value:
Array may have 3 points (transform using parallelogram) and 4 points (transform using quadrangle).
Default value is Null.
member.remarks: Points should be set in the following order: 0 - top-left, 1 - top-right, 2 - bottom-left, 3 - bottom-right.
member.exception: Thrown if array length is not equal 3 or 4.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageProcessingCommandFactory
member.summary: Provides the ability to create the image processing commands.
member.remarks:
This factory allows to override the "standard" image processing command by the command, which uses the specific image codec features and process image more effectively.
For example, PDF codec has the PdfRotateCommand and PdfDrawImageCommand classes, which processes image without the rastering of PDF page.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BorderRemovalCommand
member.summary: Detects and removes borders around an image.
member.remarks:
Here is a "good" sequence of operations for the document image processing:
1. Invert an inverted image (AutoInvertCommand from Vintasoft.Imaging.DocCleanup.dll)
2. Clear a border of an image (BorderClearCommand from Vintasoft.Imaging.DocCleanup.dll)
3. Remove halftone from an image (HalftoneRemovalCommand from Vintasoft.Imaging.DocCleanup.dll)
4. Deskew an image (DeskewCommand from Vintasoft.Imaging.DocCleanup.dll)
5. Remove hole punches from an image (HolePunchRemovalCommand from Vintasoft.Imaging.DocCleanup.dll)
6. Remove lines from an image (LineRemovalCommand from Vintasoft.Imaging.DocCleanup.dll)
7. Invert inverted text regions on an image (AutoTextInvertCommand from Vintasoft.Imaging.DocCleanup.dll)
8. Despeckle an image (DespeckleCommand from Vintasoft.Imaging.DocCleanup.dll)
9. Remove border of an image ()

member.summary: Gets a pixel format in which image must be converted.
member.value:
Supported values: PixelFormat.Bgr555, PixelFormat.Bgr565, PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Bgr32, PixelFormat.Bgr48, PixelFormat.Bgra32, PixelFormat.Bgra64.
Default value is PixelFormat.Bgr24.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangePixelFormatToBgrCommand.KeepAlphaChannel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the command must keep values of alpha channel in image data when converting image from Bgr32 format to Bgra32 format and vice versa.
member.value:
false - command will ignore values of alpha channel stored in image data; true - command will use values of alpha channel stored in image data, for example, this is necessary when bitmap is retrieved from Windows clipboard because Windows clipboard returns image as Bgr32 image but image data may contain transparent colors.
Default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the processing command need to convert the processing image to the nearest pixel format without color loss () if processing command does not support pixel format of the processing image ().
member.value: True - the processing command need to convert the processing image to the nearest pixel format without color loss; otherwise, false. Default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the processing command need to restore source pixel format of processed image if source image pixel format was change during image processing.
member.exception: Thrown if value is true.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayCommand
member.summary: Overlays image on a top of the another image.
member.remarks:
The top image will be always converted to the pixel format of the bottom image.
Palette of the bottom image will be used if bottom image is a palette image.
This command can overlay 8- and 32-bpp images with transparency, transparency of alpha component in the overlay image is used.
This command can overlay 24- and 32-bpp images with transparency, color, in overlay image, specified as transparent color is used.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayCommand.#ctor(Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Image ("top image") that should be overlaid on top of the source image.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayCommand.#ctor(Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Image ("top image") that should be overlaid on top of the source image.
Start position of the top image in the source image.
member.remarks:
The top image will be always converted to the pixel format of the bottom image.
Palette of the bottom image will be used if bottom image is a palette image.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayCommand.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the command.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayCommand.OverlayImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the image ("top image") that should be overlaid on top of the source image.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayCommand.Transparency
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the image processing command do not overlay pixel of image if pixel has transparent color.
member.value:
true - image processing command do not overlay pixel of image if pixel has transparent color; false - image processing command does not check transparency of pixel color and always overlays pixel.
Default value is false.
member.remarks: Overlay process works faster if control of transparency is disabled.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayCommand.HasTransparentColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the is used.
member.value:
true - image processing command do not overlay pixel of image if pixel color equal ; false - image processing command does not check transparency of pixel color and always overlays pixel.
Default value is false.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayCommand.TransparentColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color which must be used as transparent color.
member.remarks: Value of this property has effect only if and are set to true and source image is 24- or 32-bpp image.

member.summary: Returns the pixel format of output image (image after processing) for input image with specified pixel format.
member.returns: Pixel format of output image.

member.summary: Creates a new that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new that is a copy of this instance.

member.summary: Copies the state of the current command to the target command.
member.param: Command to copy the state of the current command to.

member.summary: Processes the image in-place.
member.returns: true if image is processed; false if processing is canceled or not necessary.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ResampleCommand
member.summary: Changes the image resolution with appropriate resizing. This command changes internal image size (in pixels), but not real image size (in inches or cm).
member.remarks: This command should be used for decreasing resolution of the image. Also it can be used for increasing resolution of the image but in this case quality of image will be reduced.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ResizeCommand.SupportedNativePixelFormats
member.summary: Gets the read-only list of supported pixel formats for this processing command.
member.value:
Supported pixel formats depend from :
Bilinear interpolation: PixelFormat.Gray8, PixelFormat.Indexed8, PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Bgr32, PixelFormat.Bgra32, PixelFormat.Gray16, PixelFormat.Bgr48, PixelFormat.Bgra64.
NearestNeighbor interpolation: PixelFormat.Gray8, PixelFormat.Bgr24, PixelFormat.Bgr32, PixelFormat.Bgra32, PixelFormat.Gray16, PixelFormat.Bgr48, PixelFormat.Bgra64.
Other interpolations: PixelFormat.Gray16, PixelFormat.Bgra32, PixelFormat.Bgr48, PixelFormat.Bgra64.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayWithBlendingCommand.#ctor(Vintasoft.Imaging.VintasoftImage,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Image ("top image") that should be overlaid on top of the source image.
Start position of the top image in the source image.
member.remarks:
The top image will be always converted to the pixel format of the bottom image.
Palette of the bottom image will be used if bottom image is a palette image.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanCommand
member.summary: Applies the arithmetic mean filter to an image.
member.remarks: An arithmetic mean filter operation on an image removes short tailed noise such as uniform and Gaussian type noise from the image at the cost of blurring the image. The arithmetic mean filter is defined as the average of all pixels within a local region of an image.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MedianCommand
member.summary: Applies the arithmetic median filter to an image. The median filter is defined as the median of all pixels within a local region of an image.
member.remarks: The median filter is normally used to reduce salt and pepper noise in an image, somewhat like the . However, it often does a better job than the of preserving useful detail in the image.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MidpointCommand
member.summary: Applies the arithmetic midpoint filter to an image.
member.remarks: In the midpoint method, the color value of each pixel is replaced with the average of maximum and minimum (i.e. the midpoint) of color values of the pixels in a surrounding region. A larger region (filter size) yields a stronger effect.

member.summary: Specifies available modes of luminance calculation.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.LuminanceComputationMode.Standard
member.summary: Luminance is calculated as 0.299 * R + 0.587 * G + 0.114 * B in case when luminance range is from 0 to 255, and 3 * (0.299 * R + 0.587 * G + 0.114 * B) in case when luminance range is from 0 to 765.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.LuminanceComputationMode.Sum
member.summary: Luminance is calculated as R + G + B in case when luminance range is from 0 to 765, and (R + G + B) / 3 in case when luminance range is from 0 to 255.

member.summary: Gets the read-only list of supported pixel formats for this processing command.

Supported pixel formats, which are supported by sequence of nested commands.
Neighboring commands are compatible if the first command returns image in pixel format, which is compatible with the input pixel format of the second command.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.CompositeCommand.Commands
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of processing commands.
member.exception: Thrown if value is null.

Thrown if the new sequence of processing commands does not have suitable input pixel formats. This means that sequence has 2 or more incompatible neighboring commands. Neighboring commands are incompatible if the first command returns image in pixel format, which is not compatible with the input pixel format of the second command.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.BorderColorType.Black
member.summary: Free space around rotated image will be filled with black color.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.BorderColorType.White
member.summary: Free space around rotated image will be filled with white color.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.BorderColorType.Transparent
member.summary: Free space around rotated image will be filled with transparent color.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.BorderColorType.Custom
